ai-pli-tv-kd3:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:1.1.2_0: At that time the Buddha had not yet laid down the rainy-season residence for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:1.1.3_0: and for the winter, the monks wandered during the rains residence.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:1.2.1_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:1.2.3_0: Even the ascetics of other religions, with their flawed teachings, settle down for the rainy-season.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:1.2.4_0: Even birds make a nest in the top of a tree and settle down for the rainy-season.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:1.2.5_0: These Sakyan ascetics go wandering in the winter, in the summer, and even during the rainy season. They are trampling down the green grass, oppressing life with one sense faculty, and destroying many small creatures.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:1.3.1_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-kd3:1.3.3_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:2.1.2_0: “When should we enter the rains residence?”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:2.1.4_0: “You should enter the rains residence in the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:2.2.4_0: “There are two entries to the rainy-season residence:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:2.2.6_0: Since the majority is applicable, acquisition of the earlier and summoned, they should go to the first and wait.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:2.2.7_0: These are the two rains residences.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.1.1_0: At that time the monks from the group of six went wandering during the rainy season.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.1.4_0: Even the ascetics of other religions, with their flawed teachings, settle down for the rainy-season.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.1.5_0: Even birds make a nest in the top of a tree and settle down for the rainy-season.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.1.6_0: These Sakyan ascetics go wandering in the winter, in the summer, and even during the rainy season. They are trampling down the green grass, oppressing life with one sense faculty, and destroying many small creatures.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.2.1_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.2.2_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.2.3_0: “How can the monks from the group of six enter the rains residence and then go wandering during the rainy season?”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.2.4_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned them:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.2.5_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.2.6_0: “After entering the rainy-season residence, you should stay put for the first or the second three-month period before you go wandering.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:3.2.7_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:4.1.1_0: The monks from the group of six did not want to enter the rains residence.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:4.1.4_0: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:4.2.1_0: At that time on the day of the monks from the group of six wanted to enter the rainy-season residence without a monastery. They wanted to enter the rainy-season residence.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:4.2.3_0: “On the day of the entry to the rainy-season residence, you should not deliberately bypass a monastery because you don’t want to enter the rainy-season residence.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:4.2.4_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:4.3.1_0: At one time King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha wanted to postpone the rains residence. He sent a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:4.3.2_0: “Would the venerables please enter the rains residence the next full moon?”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:4.3.4_0: “You should comply with the wishes of kings.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.1.1_0: When the Buddha had stayed in Rājagaha as long as he wished, he set out for Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.1.3_0: he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.1.4_0: At that time the lay follower Udena had had a dwelling built for the Sangha in the Kosalan country.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.1.5_0: He sent a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.1.6_0: “Please come, Venerables, I wish to make an offering, hear the Teaching, and see the monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.2.3_0: ʻAfter entering the rainy-season residence, I’ve stayed for the first three or the last three months of the rainy-season residence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.2.5_0: and when they have completed the rains residence, they’ll wait.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.2.6_0: But if the matter is urgent, then give the dwelling in the presence of the local monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.3.2_0: “How can the venerables not come when I’ve sent them a message?
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.3.3_0: I’m a donor and a benefactor, a supporter of the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.3.4_0: The monks heard the complaints of that lay follower
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.4.1_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.4.2_0: “If you’re sent for, I allow you to go for seven days to seven kinds of people—
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.4.3_0: a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, a novice nun, a male lay follower, or a female lay follower—
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.4.4_0: You should go for seven days to seven kinds of people—
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.4.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.5.1_0: “It may happen, monks, that a male lay follower has had a dwelling built for the Sangha
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.5.2_0: and then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.5.3_0: ʻPlease come, I wish to make an offering, hear the Teaching, and see the monks,’ you should go for seven days, but only if you’re sent for, not if you’re not.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.5.4_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.6.1_0: It may happen that a male lay follower has had a stilt house built for the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.6.20_0: or has had a site for a monastery prepared for herself.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.6.21_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.6.22_0: ʻPlease come, I wish to make an offering, hear the Teaching, and see the monks,’ you should go for seven days, but only if you’re sent for, not if you’re not.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.6.23_0: But you should return within seven days.”

ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.7.2_0: has had a dwelling built for a single monk,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.7.3_0: has had a stilt house built,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.7.22_0: or has had a site for a monastery prepared for herself.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.7.23_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.7.24_0: ʻPlease come, I wish to make an offering, hear the Teaching, and see the monks,’ you should go for seven days, but only if you’re sent for, not if you’re not.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.7.25_0: But you should return within seven days.”

ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.8.4_0: for a number of trainee nuns,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.8.6_0: for a number of novice monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.8.8_0: for a number of novice nuns,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.8.9_0: or has had a dwelling built for a single novice nun ...
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.8.10_0: has had a stilt house built,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.8.26_0: or has had a site for a monastery prepared for herself.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.8.27_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.8.28_0: ʻPlease come, I wish to make an offering, hear the Teaching, and see the monks,’ you should go for seven days, but only if you’re sent for, not if you’re not.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.8.29_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.1_0: It may happen that a male lay follower has had a house built for himself,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.6_0: has had a naked ascetic built,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.15_0: has had a taste built for taste ...
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.23_0: or has had a site for a park prepared for himself;
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.24_0: or her son is getting married,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.25_0: or her daughter is getting married,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.28_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.29_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, and learn this discourse before it gets lost,’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.30_0: or she has some duty or business and sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.31_0: ʻPlease come, I wish to make an offering, hear the Teaching, and see the monks,’ you should go for seven days, but only if you’re sent for, not if you’re not.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.9.32_0: But you should return within seven days.”

ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.10.4_0: But you should return within seven days.”

ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.11.23_0: But you should return within seven days.”

ai-pli-tv-kd3:5.13.37_0: And you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.1.1_0: At one time a monk was ill.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.1.2_0: He sent a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.1.5_0: “Even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are, I allow you to go for seven days to five kinds of people—
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.1.6_0: monks, nuns, trainee nuns, novice monks, and novice nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.1.7_0: You should go for seven days to five kinds of people—
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.1.8_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.2.1_0: “It may happen that a monk is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.2.2_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.2.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’m sick.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.2.4_0: ʻI’ll look for food for the sick one and for the nurses; I’ll look for medicine; and I’ll enquire about her sickness and nurse her.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.2.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.3.1_0: It may happen that a monk becomes discontent with the spiritual life
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.3.2_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.3.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’m discontent with the spiritual life.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.3.4_0: ʻI’ll allay his discontent or find someone else to do it, or I’ll give him a teaching.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.3.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.4.1_0: It may happen that a monk becomes anxious
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.4.2_0: and then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.4.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’m anxious.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.4.4_0: ʻI’ll dispel her anxiety or find someone else to do it, or I’ll give her a teaching.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.4.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.5.1_0: It may happen that a monk has a wrong view
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.5.2_0: and then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.5.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I have a wrong view.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.5.4_0: ʻI’ll make her give up that wrong view or get someone else to do it, or I’ll give her a teaching.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.5.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.6.1_0: “It may happen that a monk has committed a heavy offense for which he deserves to be given probation,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.6.2_0: and then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.6.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’ve committed a heavy offense for which I deserve to be given probation.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.6.4_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get him rehabilitated, I’ll do the proclamation, or I’ll complete the quorum.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.6.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.7.1_0: It may happen that a monk deserves to be sent back to the beginning,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.7.2_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.7.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I deserve to be sent back to the beginning.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.7.4_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get him sent back to the beginning, I’ll do the proclamation, or I’ll complete the quorum.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.7.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.8.1_0: It may be that a monk deserves the trial period of six days
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.8.2_0: and then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.8.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I deserve to be given the trial period.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.8.4_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get him given the trial period, I’ll do the proclamation, or I’ll complete the quorum.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.8.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.9.1_0: It may happen that a monk deserves rehabilitation,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.9.2_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.9.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I deserve rehabilitation.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.9.4_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get him rehabilitated, I’ll do the proclamation, or I’ll complete the quorum.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.9.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.10.1_0: “It may happen that the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against a monk—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.10.2_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.10.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against me.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.10.4_0: ʻHow may the Sangha not do the procedure or make it lighter?’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.10.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.11.1_0: Or it may happen that the Sangha has done a legal procedure against him—whether a procedure of condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.11.2_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.11.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure against me.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.11.4_0: ʻHow can I help him behave properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released? What can I do for the Sangha to lift that procedure?’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.11.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.12.1_0: “It may happen, monks, that a nun is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.12.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.12.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’m sick.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.12.4_0: ʻI’ll look for food for the sick one and for the nurses; I’ll look for medicine; and I’ll enquire about her sickness and nurse her.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.12.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.13.1_0: It may happen that a nun becomes discontent with the spiritual life
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.13.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.13.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’m discontent with the spiritual life.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.13.4_0: ʻI’ll allay his discontent or find someone else to do it, or I’ll give him a teaching.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.13.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.14.1_0: It may happen that a nun becomes anxious
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.14.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.14.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’m anxious.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.14.4_0: ʻI’ll dispel her anxiety or find someone else to do it, or I’ll give her a teaching.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.14.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.15.1_0: It may happen that a nun has a wrong view
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.15.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.15.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I have a wrong view.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.15.4_0: ʻI’ll make her give up that wrong view or get someone else to do it, or I’ll give her a teaching.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.15.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.16.1_0: “It may happen that a nun has committed a heavy offense for which she deserves to be given the trial period,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.16.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.16.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I deserve to be given the trial period.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.16.4_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get her given the trial period.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.16.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.17.1_0: It may happen that a nun deserves to be sent back to the beginning,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.17.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.17.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I deserve to be sent back to the beginning.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.17.4_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get her sent back to the beginning.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.17.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.18.1_0: It may happen that a nun deserves rehabilitation,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.18.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.18.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I deserve rehabilitation.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.18.4_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get her rehabilitated.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.18.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.19.1_0: “It may happen that the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against a nun—
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.19.2_0: condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—against monks without their admission.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.19.3_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.19.4_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, the Sangha wants to do a legal procedure against me.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.19.5_0: ʻHow may the Sangha not do the procedure or make it lighter?’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.19.6_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.20.1_0: Or it may happen that the Sangha has done a legal procedure against her—
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.20.2_0: condemnation, demotion, banishment, reconciliation, or ejection—against monks without their admission.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.20.3_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.20.4_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure against me.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.20.5_0: ʻHow can I help him behave properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released? What can I do for the Sangha to lift that procedure?’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.20.6_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.21.1_0: “It may happen, monks, that a trainee nun is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.21.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.21.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’m sick.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.21.4_0: ʻI’ll look for food for the sick one and for the nurses; I’ll look for medicine; and I’ll enquire about her sickness and nurse her.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.21.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.22.1_0: It may happen that a trainee nun becomes discontent with the spiritual life,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.22.4_0: or has failed in the training,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.22.5_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.22.6_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’ve failed in the training.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.22.7_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get her to undertake the training of a trainee nun.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.22.8_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.23.1_0: It may happen that a trainee nun desires the full ordination
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.23.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.23.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I desire the full ordination.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.23.4_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get him the full ordination, I’ll do the proclamation, or I’ll complete the quorum.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.23.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.24.1_0: “It may happen that a novice monk is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.24.2_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.24.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’m sick.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.24.4_0: ʻI’ll look for food for the sick one and for the nurses; I’ll look for medicine; and I’ll enquire about her sickness and nurse her.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.24.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.25.1_0: It may happen that a novice monk becomes discontent with the spiritual life,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.25.4_0: or wants to ask about his age,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.25.5_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.25.6_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I want to ask about my age.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.25.7_0: ʻI’ll ask him, or I’ll inform him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.25.8_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.26.1_0: It may happen that a novice monk desires the full ordination
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.26.2_0: If he then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.26.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I desire the full ordination.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.26.4_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get him the full ordination, I’ll do the proclamation, or I’ll complete the quorum.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.26.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.27.1_0: “It may happen that a novice nun is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.27.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.27.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’m sick.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.27.4_0: ʻI’ll look for food for the sick one and for the nurses; I’ll look for medicine; and I’ll enquire about her sickness and nurse her.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.27.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.28.1_0: It may happen that a novice nun becomes discontent with the spiritual life,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.28.4_0: or want to ask about his age,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.28.5_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.28.6_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I want to ask about my age.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.28.7_0: ʻI’ll ask him, or I’ll inform him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.28.8_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.29.1_0: It may happen that a novice nun desires to undertake the training of a trainee nun
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.29.2_0: If she then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.29.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I desire to undertake the training.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.29.4_0: ʻI’ll make an effort to get her to undertake the training of a trainee nun.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:6.29.5_0: And you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.1.0_0: The allowance to go to seven kinds of people even if not sent for
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.1.1_0: On one occasion the mother of a certain monk was sick.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.1.2_0: She sent a message to her son:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.1.5_0: that the Buddha had laid down a rule
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.1.6_0: ‘If you’re sent for, let alone if you are, you’re not sent for, not if you’re not.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.1.7_0: and that one should go for seven days to five kinds of people, even if not sent for, let alone if one is.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.1.8_0: My mother is sick, but she’s not a lay follower. So what should I do?”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.2.1_0: “Even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are, I allow you to go for seven days to seven kinds of people—
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.2.2_0: a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice nun, a novice nun, your mother, your father.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.2.3_0: You should go for seven days to seven kinds of people—
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.2.4_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.3.1_0: “It may happen that a monk is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.3.2_0: and sends a message to her son:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.3.3_0: ʻPlease come, I’m sick.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.3.4_0: ʻI’ll look for food for the sick one and for the nurses; I’ll look for medicine; and I’ll enquire about her sickness and nurse her.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.3.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.4.1_0: It may happen that a monk’s father is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.4.3_0: ʻPlease come, I’m sick.’ Then—even if you’re not sent for, let alone if you are—you should go for seven days, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.4.4_0: ʻI’ll look for food for the sick one and for the nurses; I’ll look for medicine; and I’ll enquire about her sickness and nurse her.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.4.5_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.5.1_0: “It may happen that a monk’s brother is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.5.2_0: and sends a message to his brother:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.5.3_0: ʻPlease come, I’m sick.’ You should go for seven days, but only if you’re sent for, not if you’re not.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.5.4_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.6.1_0: “It may happen that a monk’s sister is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.6.2_0: and sends a message to her brother:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.6.3_0: ʻPlease come, I’m sick.’ You should go for seven days, but only if you’re sent for, not if you’re not.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.6.4_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.7.1_0: It may happen that a monk’s relative is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.7.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerable, I’m sick.’ You should go for seven days, but only if you’re sent for, not if you’re not.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.7.4_0: But you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.8.1_0: It may happen that one who is staying with monks is sick
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.8.2_0: and then sends a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.8.3_0: ʻPlease come, Venerables, I’m sick.’ You should go for seven days, but only if you’re sent for, not if you’re not.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:7.8.4_0: And you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:8.1.1_0: At one time when one of the Sangha’s dwellings was falling apart,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:8.1.2_0: the timber belonging to a certain lay follower had been cut up in the wilderness.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:8.1.3_0: He sent a message to the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:8.1.4_0: “Venerables, if you retrieve that timber, I’ll give it to you.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:8.1.6_0: “I allow you to go on business for the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:8.1.7_0: And you should return within seven days.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:8.1.8_0: The section for recitation on the rainy-season residence is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.1.0_0: The section on no offense for breaking the rains residence if there are dangers
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.1.1_0: At one time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country, monks who had entered the rains residence were harassed by predatory animals
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.1.4_0: “It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence are harassed by predatory animals
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.1.6_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.1.7_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.1.8_0: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence are harassed by creeping animals
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.1.10_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.1.11_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.2.1_0: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence are harassed by criminals
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.2.3_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.2.4_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.2.5_0: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence are harassed by demons
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.2.6_0: who take possession of them and kill them.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.2.7_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.2.8_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.3.1_0: “It may happen that the village where the monks have entered the rains residence burns.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.3.2_0: As a consequence, they have trouble getting almsfood.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.3.3_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.3.4_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.3.5_0: “It may happen that the dwellings where the monks have entered the rains residence burn down.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.3.6_0: As a consequence, they are short of dwellings.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.3.7_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.3.8_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.4.1_0: It may happen that the village where the monks have entered the rains residence is swept away by water.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.4.2_0: As a consequence, they have trouble getting almsfood.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.4.3_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.4.4_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.4.5_0: It may happen that the dwellings where the monks have entered the rains residence are swept away by water.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.4.6_0: As a consequence, they are short of dwellings.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.4.7_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:9.4.8_0: There’s no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:10.1.1_0: At one time in a certain monastery, the village where the monks had entered the rains residence relocated because of criminals.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:10.1.3_0: “I allow you to move to where the village is.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:10.1.4_0: The village was divided in two.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:10.1.6_0: “I allow you to move to where the majority is.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:10.1.7_0: The majority had no faith and confidence.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:10.1.9_0: “I allow you to move to where those who have faith and confidence are.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.1.1_0: At one time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country, the monks who had entered the rains residence did not get enough food, whether coarse or fine.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.1.3_0: “It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence don’t get enough food, whether coarse or fine.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.1.4_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.1.5_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.1.6_0: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence get enough suitable food, whether coarse or fine.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.1.7_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.1.8_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.2.1_0: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence get enough suitable food, whether coarse or fine, but they don’t get suitable medicines.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.2.2_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.2.3_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.2.4_0: It may happen that monks who have entered the rains residence get enough suitable food, whether coarse or fine, as well as suitable medicines.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.2.5_0: When there is such an obstacle, you should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.2.6_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.3.1_0: It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence is invited by a woman
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.3.2_0: ‘Come, give us a golden garland. I give it to your slaves, give it away, and use it to your slaves. I give it to your slaves, your mother and father. I give it to you.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.3.4_0: ʻThe Buddha has said that the mind is volatile, and so this could be an danger to my living the spiritual life,’ he should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.3.5_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.4.1_0: It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence is invited by a prostitute,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.4.8_0: ‘Come, give money to your slaves! We give it to you. We give it to your slaves and marriages.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.4.10_0: ʻThe Buddha has said that the mind is volatile, and so this could be an danger to my living the spiritual life,’ he should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.4.11_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.4.12_0: It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence sees an ownerless treasure.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.4.14_0: ʻThe Buddha has said that the mind is volatile, and so this could be an danger to my living the spiritual life,’ he should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.4.15_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.5.0.1_0: The section on no offense for breaking the rains residence when there is schism in the Sangha
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.5.1_0: “It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence sees a number of monks who are pursuing schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.5.3_0: ‘The Buddha has caused schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.5.4_0: don’t leave me in the presence of the Sangha. The Sangha should leave them.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.5.5_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.5.6_0: “It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence hears
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.5.7_0: that a number of monks in such-and-such a monastery are pursuing schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.5.9_0: ‘The Buddha has caused schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.5.10_0: don’t leave me in the presence of the Sangha. The Sangha should leave them.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.5.11_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.6.1_0: “It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence hears
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.6.2_0: that a number of monks in such-and-such a monastery are pursuing schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.6.5_0: I must tell them what the Buddha has said about schism in the Sangha being a serious matter,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.6.6_0: and I must ask them not to consent to it.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.6.7_0: They will act on what I say. They will listen and pay careful attention,’ then he should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.6.8_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.7.1_0: “It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence hears
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.7.2_0: that a number of monks in such-and-such a monastery are pursuing schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.7.4_0: ʻThose monks are not my friends,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.7.5_0: but we have friends in common.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.7.7_0: They say that they have spoken of schism in the Sangha being a serious matter,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.7.8_0: and I must ask them not to consent to it.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.7.9_0: Those monks will act on what my friends say. They will listen and pay careful attention,’ then he should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.7.10_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.8.1_0: “It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence hears
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.8.2_0: that a number of monks in such-and-such a monastery have created a schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.8.5_0: I must tell them what the Buddha has said about schism in the Sangha being a serious matter,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.8.6_0: and I must ask them not to consent to it.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.8.7_0: They will act on what I say. They will listen and pay careful attention,’ then he should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.8.8_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.9.1_0: “It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence hears
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.9.2_0: that a number of monks in such-and-such a monastery have created a schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.9.4_0: ʻThose monks are not my friends,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.9.5_0: but we have friends in common.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.9.7_0: They say that they have spoken of schism in the Sangha being a serious matter,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.9.8_0: and I must ask them not to consent to it.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.9.9_0: Those monks will act on what my friends say. They will listen and pay careful attention,’ then he should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.9.10_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.10.1_0: “It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence hears
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.10.2_0: that a number of nuns in such-and-such a monastery are pursuing schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.10.5_0: I must tell them what the Buddha has said about schism in the Sangha being a serious matter,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.10.6_0: and I must ask them not to consent to it.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.10.7_0: They will act on what I say. They will listen and pay careful attention,’ then he should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.10.8_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.11.1_0: “It may happen that a monk who has entered the rains residence hears
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.11.2_0: that a number of nuns in such-and-such a monastery are pursuing schism in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.11.4_0: ʻThose nuns are not my friends,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.11.5_0: but we have friends in common.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.11.6_0: If I speak to my friends,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.11.7_0: they will tell those nuns what the Buddha has said about schism in the Sangha being a serious matter,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.11.8_0: and I must ask them not to consent to it.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.11.9_0: Those nuns will act on what my friends say. They will listen and pay careful attention,’ then he should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.11.10_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”

ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.12.5_0: I must tell them what the Buddha has said about schism in the Sangha being a serious matter,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.12.6_0: and I must ask them not to consent to it.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.12.7_0: They will act on what I say. They will listen and pay careful attention,’ then he should leave.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:11.12.8_0: There is no offense for breaking the rains residence.”

ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.1.1_0: On one occasion a certain monk wanted to enter the rains residence in a cowherd’s dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.1.3_0: “I allow you to enter the rains residence in a cowherd’s dwelling.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.1.6_0: “I allow you to move to where the cowherd’s dwelling is.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.2.1_0: On one occasion, as the entry to the rains residence was getting close, a certain monk wanted to travel by caravan.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.2.3_0: “I allow you to enter the rains residence in a caravan.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.2.4_0: On one occasion, as the entry to the rains residence was getting close, a certain monk wanted to travel by boat.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.2.6_0: “I allow you to enter the rains residence in a boat.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.3.1_0: At one time monks entered the rains residence in the hollow of a tree.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.3.2_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.3.5_0: “You should not enter the rains residence in the hollow of a tree.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.3.6_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.4.1_0: At one time monks entered the rains residence in the fork of a tree.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.4.2_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.4.5_0: “You should not enter the rains residence in the fork of a tree.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.4.6_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.5.1_0: At one time monks entered the rains residence out in the open.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.5.2_0: When it was raining, they ran for cover under trees or eaves.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.5.4_0: “You should not enter the rains residence out in the open.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.5.5_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.6.1_0: At one time monks entered the rains residence without a dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.6.2_0: They suffered in the cold and the heat.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.6.4_0: “You should not enter the rains residence without a dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.6.5_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.7.1_0: At one time monks entered the rains residence under a sunshade.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.7.2_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.7.5_0: “You should not enter the rains residence in a charnel house.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.7.6_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.8.1_0: At one time monks entered the rains residence under a sunshade.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.8.2_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.8.5_0: “You should not enter the rains residence under a sunshade.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.8.6_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.9.1_0: At one time monks entered the rains residence in a large vessel.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.9.2_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.9.3_0: “He’s just like the ascetics of other religions.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.9.5_0: “You should not enter the rains residence in a large vessel.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:12.9.6_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.1.1_0: Soon afterwards the Sangha at Sāvatthī made the following agreement:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.1.2_0: that they would not give the going forth during the rains residence.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.1.3_0: On one occasion one of Visākhā’s grandsons went to the monks and asked for the going forth.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.1.6_0: adding, “Wait while the monks are observing the rains residence.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.1.7_0: Once we’ve completed the rains residence, we’ll give you the going forth.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.1.8_0: Soon afterwards, after completing the rainy-season residence, those monks said to Migāra’s mother,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.1.11_0: “If I’ve gone forth, I’d wish to take it.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.1.12_0: But now I won’t not go forth.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.2.1_0: Visākhā complained and criticized those monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.2.2_0: “How can the venerables make an agreement
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.2.3_0: that you won’t give the going forth during the rains residence?
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.2.4_0: Is there a time when the Teaching should not be practiced?”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.2.8_0: that you won’t give the going forth during the rains residence?
ai-pli-tv-kd3:13.2.9_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.1.1_0: On one occasion Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had assented to spend the first rains residence at the invitation of King Pasenadi of Kosala.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.1.2_0: While on his way to that monastery, he saw two monasteries with much robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.1.4_0: “Why don’t I dwell in these two rains residences
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.1.5_0: In that way I’ll get much robe-cloth.”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.1.6_0: And he spent the rains residence in those two monasteries.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.1.7_0: King Pasenadi complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.1.8_0: “How could Upananda agree to spend the rains residence in my monastery, but then break his word?
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.1.9_0: Hasn’t the Buddha in many ways criticized lying and praised the abstention from lying?”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.2.1_0: The monks heard the King’s complaints,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.2.2_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.2.4_0: Hasn’t the Buddha in many ways criticized lying and praised the abstention from lying?”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.3.1_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned them:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.3.2_0: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Upananda:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.3.3_0: “Is it true that you acted like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.3.6_0: “... Foolish man, how can you agree to spend the rains residence at the invitation of King Pasenadi, but then break your word?
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.3.7_0: Haven’t I given many ways criticized lying and praised the abstention from lying?
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.3.8_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.3.10_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.4.1_0: “It may happen that a monk assents to spend the first rains residence in a particular monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.4.2_0: While on his way to that monastery, he sees two monasteries with much robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.4.4_0: ‘Why don’t I provide the rains residence in these two monasteries?
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.4.5_0: In that way I’ll get much robe-cloth.’
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.4.6_0: And he does spend the rains residence in those two monasteries.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.4.7_0: The first rains residence doesn’t count for that monk. And there is an offense of wrong conduct for the assenting.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.5.1_0: “It may happen that a monk assents to spend the first rains residence in a particular monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.5.2_0: While on his way to that monastery, he does the observance-day procedure outside. On the following day, he enters and prepares the dwelling, sets out water for drinking and water for washing, and sweeps the precincts.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.5.3_0: He then leaves on that very day, despite not having any business.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.5.4_0: The first rains residence doesn’t count for that monk. And there is an offense of wrong conduct for the assenting.

ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.11.74_0: and six years in the six huts,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.11.80_0: if she departs without taking leave;
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.11.81_0: whoever is always devoted to what is good,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.11.84_0: Those sentient beings who have gone astray,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.11.85_0: you should come along or were to come along,
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.11.88_0: In this chapter there are fifty-two topics.
ai-pli-tv-kd3:14.11.89_0: The chapter on entering the rainy-season residence is finished.
